intro: Stigmaphyllon stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Stigmaphyllon stenophyllum is often found in humid, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded undergrowth.
